Initialized(uint8).details: Triggered when the contract has been initialized or reinitialized.

constructor.details: this protects the implementation contract from behing initialized.

returns.recipients: array of royalty recipients through the splitter and their splits of royalty.

params._royaltyManager: the address of the royalty manager contract
params.recipientAddress: the wallet of the creator when the contract is deployed

returns._0: true if the address is the same as the trusted forwarder

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

setRecipients((address,uint16)[]).details: only the owner can call this.

params.recipients: the array of recipients which should only have one recipient.

splitERC20Tokens(address).details: can only be called by one of the recipients

params.erc20Contract: the address of the tokens to be split.

splitETH().details: normally ETH should be split automatically by receive function.

params.interfaceId: the interface identifier, as specified in ERC-165.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

getRecipients().notice: to get recipients of royalty through this splitter and their splits of royalty.

isTrustedForwarder(address).notice: return true if the forwarder is the trusted forwarder

splitERC20Tokens(address).notice: split ERC20 Tokens owned by this contract.

splitETH().notice: Splits and forwards ETH to the royalty receivers

supportsInterface(bytes4).notice: Query if a contract implements interface `id`.

userdoc.notice: RoyaltySplitter contract is deployed by the RoyaltyManager contract for a creator to get his royalty's share.
